The fercönyng's court was rumored to pay well for such artifacts and the brigands hoped to fetch a good price for the morning star when they returned to the Empire. Unfortunately for them, they were intercepted by a scouting party of the Glanfathan Fangs and charged with violating the sacred site. The evidence against the looters was overwhelming and they were summarily sentenced to death. The Fangs carried out the sentence at the threshold of the ruins, using this morning star as the means of execution. The Aedyran's bodies were left as a warning to other potential despoilers.

'''{{Pagename nd}}''' is a {{lc:Morning star}} in {{poe2}}.

##  Description 

{{Description |{{#var:description}}}}

##  Usage 

* The Poison Dipped status effect inflicted by Saru-Sichr is a separate attack targeting Fortitude, rather than Deflection.
* Despite the wording of the enchantment, the separate attack roll is made on Grazes as well.
* The Poison Dipped status effect's damage scales with the Quality enchantment on Saru-Sichr, Might and the Two-Handed Style passive.
